page.title: 05ARABLE FARMING IN BANKS
page.content: WE WENT ON A VISIT TO OLD HOLLOW FARM WHICH IS A 300 ACRE ARABLE FARM IN BANKS.THE OWNER GROWS BARLEY,BEETROOT, CAULIFLOWERS,CABBAGES AND SPROUTS. IT WAS CALLED OLD HOLLOW AFTER A LARGE GUTTER WHICH WAS NATURAL AND 5 METRES DEEP. THE SOIL IS SILTLAND AND VERY FERTILE. ABOUT 20 MEN AND 10 WOMEN WORK THERE.THE PRODUCE IS TAKEN BY LO RRIES TO NEARBY WHOLESALE MARKETS. THE OWNER HAS COVERTS AND A SMALL LAKE FOR WILD GEESE AND DUCKS. HE IS VERY INTERESTED IN THE CONSERVATION OF NATURE AND WILDLIFE.PART OF THE LAND IS UNDER THE NATURE CONSERVANCY COUNCIL. THE FARMER USES MODERN FARMING METHODS BUT IS ALERT TO THE NEEDS OF WILDLIFE. MOST OF THE ARABLE FARMS IN THE AREA ARE SMALLER,BEING ABOUT 50 TO 80 ACRES. MARKET GARDENS ARE SMALLER STILL DUE TO THE INTENSIVE NATURE OF THIS FARMING.
